---
title: Spine MSK
subtitle: A Musculoskeletal Overview
---


A normal spine consists of curvature in the *sagittal* plane where the cervical and lumbar segments are in *lordosis* and the thoraic segment is in *kyphosis* @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017.

A number of anatomic factors influence this curvature:

- Wedge-shaped [intervertebral discs (IVDs)]({{< var ref-intervertebral-disc.path >}})
- Spatial orientation of the apophyseal (facet) joints @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017.
- Histologic composition of ligaments @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017.
- Degree of natural muscle stiffness @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017.
